thread.title: Thanks to Brexit, we can reshape our laws for the internet era
thread.title_full: Thanks to Brexit, we can reshape our laws for the internet era

author: Tom Tugendhat
title: Thanks to Brexit, we can reshape our laws for the internet era
text:
G enerals aren’t the only ones inclined to fight the last war. Governments do it too. Today, across the world, countries are behaving as though technology had not changed the world and as though old ways of doing things can endure.
HM Treasury, through business rates that punish high street shops over distribution centres , through tax rules that pick winners and grant breaks to the industries that catch the Chancellor’s eye, misses the point. It is manning a Maginot Line in a world of blitzkrieg.
O ur courts find themselves in much the same place. Judges are being asked to apply codes, laws and regulations written for another era.
Nowhere is this clearer that online platforms. Is a peer-to-peer lender a bank? Is a taxi app an employer ? Is a social network a publisher? Though often the initial appearance gives one answer, the platforms themselves evolve and become something else. Regulation and...
